page.title: 07Leisure Centre Pontardawe
page.content: This centre was recently opened on an old steelworks site known as Parc Ynisderw. It is the first of its kind in Wales, being built to a standard design devised and approved by the Sports Council. It is open to the public for sporting and leisure activities from 10.00 to 22.00 every day. Dominating the centre is an air conditioned main hall, which houses badminton courts and is also marked out for basketball, netball, hockey and volleyball. Other sports catered for will be cricket, roller-skating, table tennis, martial arts, gymnastics and trampolining. The hall will also be used for social and other events. Outdoor facilities consist of a changing room complex, rugby & soccer pitches, artificial cricket wickets, picnic area, play park and trim trail.
